text: The 1993 Icelandic Cup was the 34th edition of the National Football Cup. It took place between 26 May 1993 and 29 August 1993, with the final played at Laugardalsvöllur in Reykjavik. The cup was important, as winners qualified for the UEFA Cup Winners' Cup (if a club won both the league and the cup, the defeated finalists would take their place in the Cup Winners' Cup). The 10 clubs from the 1. Deild entered in the last 16, with clubs from lower tiers entering in the three preliminary rounds. Teams played one-legged matches. In case of a draw, a penalty shoot-out took place (there were no replays, unlike in previous years). ÍA Akranes, 1993 Icelandic Champions, won the double by beating ÍBK Keflavík in the final to win their sixth Icelandic Cup, and qualify for Europe. == Second round == {| class="wikitable gauche" | width="180" | Team 1 | width="180" | Team 2 | width="80" | Result |- | IR Reykjavik (D2)|| Stjarnan Gardabaer (D2)|| align="center" | 1-2 |- | BÍ Ísafjörður (D2) || HK Kopavogur (D3) || align="center" | 1-1 (HK Kopavogur win on penalties) |- | AEgir || Grótta Seltjarnarnes || align="center" | 3 -3 (Grótta Seltjarnarnes win on penalties) |- | Haukar Hafnarfjörður || Fjölnir Reykjavík || align="center" | 4 - 0 |- | Víðir Garður (D3) || þrottur Reykjavik (D2) || align="center" | 2 - 1 |- | Einherji || Höttur Egilsstaðir || align="center" | 1 - 2 |- | Austri Eskifjörður || Huginn Seyðisfjörður || align="center" | 4-2 |- | Leiftur Olafsfjordur (D2) || Austri Rh. || align="center" | 16-0 |- | Völsungur Húsavík || Tindastoll Saudarkrokur (D2) || align="center" | 5-2 |- | Neisti Hof || KA Akureyri (D2) || align="center" | 0-7 |- | KS Siglufjörður || Hvöt Blönduós || align="center" | 0-2 |- | Breiðablik Kopavogur (D2) || Afturelding Mosfellsbær || align="center" | 2-0 |- |} == Third round == {| class="wikitable gauche" | width="180" | Team 1 | width="180" | Team 2 | width="80" | Result |- | Hvöt Blönduós || KA Akureyri (D2) || align="center" | 3 - 5 |- | Stjarnan Gardabaer (D2) || HK Kopavogur (D3) || align="center" |2 -3 |- | Völsungur Húsavík || Leiftur Olafsfjordur (D2) || align="center" | 0 - 2 |- | Víðir Garður (D3) || Haukar Hafnarfjörður || align="center" |3-0 |- | Grótta Seltjarnarnes || Breiðablik Kopavogur (D2) || align="center" | 1- 6 |- | Austri Eskifjörður || Höttur Egilsstaðir || align="center" |0 - 7 |- |} == Fourth round == * Entry of ten teams from the 1.
